intro: Phlegmariurus brassii, commonly known as the yellow spruce moss, is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is characterized by its dense, cushion-like growth form and bright yellow to greenish-yellow coloration. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in temperate regions on rocks or soil. Its leaves are small, elongated, and often have a distinct midrib, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Phlegmariurus brassii plays a role in soil stabilization and provides microhabitat for various invertebrates.
